column2: The best fighters always seek to prove their worth to the Tzar.
On the side of Boris ride the Gryphon Legion, their feathered banners quivering in the wind.
Bohka Palace is guarded by three hundred Kreml Guards, the most loyal soldiers to the Tzar who have swore to protect him with their lives.
Bastard Empire! Kept safe with Kislev blood! You and your land be dead but for us.
In the years of Boris' reign, Kislev grew strong both in military and economy.
Kislev! Boris shouted, his deep voice booming across the snow scape. The bear roared, joining his master in the sound of triumph.
The Priest's chants fill his warriors with implacable, ferocious rage.
The Priest's rousing prayers grant his followers strength and courage as they tap deep into Kislevite national pride.
The champions of the Tzarina need the best armour.
This man has cheated death again and again. Praise Ursun as he surely watches over him.
Come now comrades, there is enough meat and kvas for everyone. Let us feast!
From the frozen steppes, the great bears and majestic hawks heed the call of the Land.
Many comrades seek the Priests from the Cult of Ursun before a great battle.
The constant threat from the North is forcing the smiths to improve their weapon and armour craftmanship year after year.
Even if the use of gunpowder weapons has always been rather limited, the supplies coming in from trade are always useful.
Honing their bow skills for years, the Ungols and Kossars have specialized in ambushes.
The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.
Then the Winged Lancers arrived, galloped into the back of the enemy lines and turned the tide.
It appears a spell of some sort has been cast on the frontline of Boris' army. Could it be a Hag Witch hidden in the woods?
Kislev breeds hardy and fierce warriors both due to the climate and the constant depredations by raiders from the Chaos Wastes.
Bloody Kislevites! Don't they ever relax?
Following the devastation and ruin of the Great War against Chaos, Tzar Boris Bokha was instrumental in rebuilding the nation of Kislev and reclaiming many of its lost lands.
Kislevites are willing and motivated soldiers, who know that they are defending their homes and families.
The constant threat from the North is forcing the Ungols to improve their weapon and armour craftmanship even while living in the open steppes.
You'll find no sturdier or faster warhorse than those the Ungols ride, comrade.
They grew up in the steppes as free men. They will never give up their freedom.
May Dazh watch over us and our children and our lands.
Boris Bokha is a fiery, passionate warrior with a driving spirit and eagerness to reclaim the lost glory of Kislev.
Their speed with a blade is blistering, said to be only bettered by the Elves, and even then, many doubt that.
Surrounded and cut off the rest of his army, Boris Bokha continues to fight. The spirit of the Bear God never ceases to burn inside of him.
The Hag transforms into a grey-haired\\nmonstrosity over eight feet in height, with glowing\\neyes, rusted metal teeth, and long, iron talons.
The Droyaska are the greatest fighters in the Kislev nation. It is a title that only the Tzar or Tzarina herself can formally grant.
